Legal_Issue: Justification for removal from elected position under election regulations
Evidence_Assessment: No evidence supported the alleged violation of Section 4(B)
Decision_Outcome: Removal decision found to be unreasonable
Burden_of_Proof: On the Committee to justify removal
Credibility_Factor: Lack of written record and clear reasons affected credibility of the Committee's decision
Legal_Rule: Regulations and procedural fairness principles govern election disputes
Procedural_Issue: Failure to maintain written record and provide clear reasons
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged violation of Section 4(B) by contacting electors without consent
Outcome_on_Merits: Claim dismissed due to lack of evidence and procedural unfairness
Judicial_Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, Mr. Testawich reinstated
Key_Evidence_Considered: Absence of evidence supporting violation, lack of documentation
Legal_Framework: Duncan First Nation Election Regulations, principles of procedural fairness
Applicant_Challenge: Challenge to validity of removal from office
Court_Result: Reinstatement with back pay, nullification of by-election, award of costs
Defendant_Response: Not explicitly stated, but failure to provide evidence or reasoning
Evidence_Type: Documentary and procedural record (or lack thereof)
Outcome: Reinstatement granted, by-election nullified, back pay and costs awarded
Legal_Provision: Section 4(B) of the Duncan First Nation Election Regulations
Applicable_Process: Election dispute resolution under First Nation regulations
Jurisdiction: First Nation internal jurisdiction subject to judicial review
